text:
Can a wave of sufficient complexity describe literally anything? Are waves the fundamental language of the Universe?

Waves are a curious commonality -- a sort of unifying principle. Sound | Light | Gravity | Probability. Any changing thing can be described by waves, including the fictions of humans.

Waves are the language of energy, and energy is information.
